newsitem.title: SWITZERLAND: FREESTYLE SKIING-EDMONDSON HAS FIRST WIN IN 15 YEARS.
newsitem.headline: FREESTYLE SKIING-EDMONDSON HAS FIRST WIN IN 15 YEARS.

text.p: American Ian Edmondson collected his first freestyle skiing World Cup win in 15 years on Saturday with a victory in the acro-ski competition.
Edmondson, who will turn 40 next month and plans to compete until the 2002 Olympics in Salt Lake City if acrobatic skiing gains full medal status, finished with a score of 26.75 points.
Fabrice Becker of France, the winner of five events this season and leader of the World Cup standings, was second with 26.45 and Antti Inberg of Finland third in 25.90.
The victory was Edmondson's first since he returned to competition in 1992 following a 10-year retirement.
"This win is the result of a long struggle," said Edmondson. "Sometimes I questioned why I came out of retirement but today I entertained myself as well as the crowd."
Led by Elena Batalova, Russian skiers swept the top three places in the women's competition.
Batalova was marked at 26.25 followed by team mates Oksana Kouchenko (25.70) and Natalia Razoumovska (25.60).
